meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by bacteria
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the bacillary infection.
meanings.sent2: The bacillary culture in the lab showed the presence of harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The bacillary party of bacteria danced under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The bacillary nature of the infection spread rapidly through the community.
meanings.sent5: The bacillary colonies multiplied in the warm, moist environment.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or resembling rods or rod-shaped structures
meanings.sent1: The bacillary shape of the crystals was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, the bacillary structures appeared elongated and thin.
meanings.sent3: The bacillary rods lined up like soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent4: The bacillary pattern of the fence created a unique visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The bacillary design of the building gave it a modern and sleek look.
